author: Tiffany Dunk
title: Erik Thomson from 800 Words talks the importance of family on the set | DailyTelegraph
text:
ALMOST three years ago, Erik Thomson was sent a treatment for 800 Words, a trans-Tasman family drama created specifically with him in mind.
“My wife (actress Caitlin McDougall) will tell you that when I read it I got a little bit of tear because it moved me,” he recalls of the tale which sees recent widower George Turner pick his grieving family up and transplant them to a small town in New Zealand.
“I needed to do this.”
Persistence paid off ... Erik is joined by fellow Aussie actress Bridie Carter on 800 Words. Picture: Supplied
Surfing the wave ... Rick Donald (right) says Thomson is the “skipper” of the show. Picture: Supplied
Family man ... Erik and his onscreen kids Melina Vidler and Benson Jack Anthony share a bond on and off screen. Picture: Tim Hunter
Learning curve ... Thomson says that his Rafters wife Rebecca Gibney taught him how to be everyone’s rock on 800 Words. Picture: Supplied
String of success ... Georgie Parker and Thomson were a massive hit in All Saints. Picture: Supplied
Key player ... Thomson was a legendary pants man on Aussie soap Pacific Drive, pictured here with Melissa Tkautz, Simone Buchanan and Danielle Spencer. Picture: Supplied
Family man ... Thomson and his wife Caitlin McDougall met on the set of Always Greener. Picture: Supplied
